website_summaries.verdict: We love this versatile tool. Capable of handling a variety of wood-working jobs with power and precision.
pros: This joiner offers ample cutting power
Dual rack and pinion fence keeps everything in the right position for precise joints and cuts
cons: Can be a tad difficult to configure

customer_reviews.title: Can't get a parallel cut...
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: I'm a DeWalt guy. Typical DeWalt tools work out of the box for me. I own a DeWalt planer, miter saw, table saw, multiple sanders), but this one didn't fit the bill. The fence is about 1/32" out of parallel to the blade, even after adjusting the fence with the two set screws as far as they will go. This one is going back. I will try another because the tool is very easy to use, and the price is right. I hope this isn't a common theme with these joiners...
customer_reviews.author: MidCitySlim

customer_reviews.title: Not Parallel
customer_reviews.text: See attached picture: plate cutter is not parallel to the fence. From other 1-star reviews for the DW682K, you'll find my experience is not an isolated incident.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt fanboy but this fell short
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable plate was 1/16+ out of square and also milled with a radius in it. Overall alignment was just off and it had some slop in it. Very disappointed. Please look at customers pictures because this seems to be a trend.. returned it and ordered the porter cable version.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy trust me
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but felt I had to on this product. Very poor performance.would not cut level. Tried adjusting but found housings had to much clearance that allowed misfit issues. Sending back for refund and hopefully different brand with better results. I'm a hard core dewalt guy and very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Warped Blade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and it arrived on time as always. Only problem is the cut is too wide for the biscuit by more than 1/32 sometimes larger depending on the biscuit and amount of operator error. There were times my joints would shift during practice glue ups to about 1/16 of an inch. For the longest time I thought I was messing something up and simply stopped using the tool. I finally removed the blade thinking I was going to shim it to make up for what is suspected was a wobble. Come to find out the blade itself is warped. Not what I expected from a $200 tool. Somewhat disappointed but hopefully the new blade with fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the hard sided cases?
customer_reviews.text: The picture clearly shows a hard sided case. If your buying tools on amazon, you’re probably not reading entire description because you’ve already done your research and are just looking for best price. Description does clearly state it comes with soft sided bag. Update the picture.
customer_reviews.author: B.N.

customer_reviews.title: Good but better tools are available
customer_reviews.text: I had this jointer for a couple of years before someone broke into my shop and stole it. I liked the DEWALT biscuit jointer a lot until after someone took it I borrowed a neighbor’s porter cable unit. The porter cable unit allows much better tracking and precision. I am usually very loyal to DEWALT but I decided to buy the PC model. As I said this is a good jointer, it is just a little more basic and requires much more care and layout.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to have.
customer_reviews.text: First time using a biscuit joiner. I tried it on some scrap wood and found out I needed to adjust it (hence the -1 star). Luckily I found a video on YouTube of a guy from the UK showing how to adjust the baseplate. Works great now and I’m getting better on the miter joints with practice!
customer_reviews.author: Not sarcastic at all

customer_reviews.title: This is the joiner to get!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Ryobi for a few days, then returned it due to an out-of-alignment screw that was causing all the joints to be off. Got this DW instead and glad I did. It's much nicer than the Ryobi. Here's why: the ryobi chip exhaust clogged a lot and the vertical scale is hard to read. The DW is much better. I've also tried the beadlock system (where you drill a 3-4 hole dowel in). It makes a super strong joint, but I find the plate joiner is easier to get a flush joint.
customer_reviews.author: Marc SantaCruz

customer_reviews.title: No misalignment on mine.
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews claiming a crooked slot being cut. Mine will also cut a crooked slot if I'm not holding it correctly. I got mine for $100 during a sale, and can't complain at all. It is very well built and cuts how it's suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: David Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough for my money.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as another recent reviewer, the castings that make up the fence/slide mechanism were machined/cast with too much play in them, which combined with the torque of the motor to skew the angle of the cutter head during operation. I am extremely disappointed by the lack of quality control from Dewalt on this tool. I have returned it and am waiting on a replacement from a competing brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Croley

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: The tool is a great addition to the shop. Have used it to join angles on a 3 cornered cabinet I am in process of making. Although a bit too soon to rate it for durability I don't expect any issues with DeWalt tools. I gave it a 4 because, as several of the reviews I read before purchasing, the exhaust port clogs easily. I may try to get adapters to hook up my Shop Vac and see if that helps. I would definately recommend this tool to anyone in the market for a good plate jointer.
customer_reviews.author: Oboy

customer_reviews.title: A reliable winner!
customer_reviews.text: What a great machine! I was a beginner in wood work and this little thing has helped me so much! It is not very big but the engine is strong, it has never bog down. Also, I’ve had it for 3 years now and used it on almost every project and it is still running like new. It is easy to use and you get a good strong easy grip on it. Dewalt made a winner with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Garnier

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it is probably operator error, but it doesn't create even joints on a glue up. Tried referencing the face and the fence, even adjusted the bottom since it comes from the factory uneven, no luck. Cutter blade and action are smooth, so could be very useful for someone with more knowledge on how to tinker with tools to get them to cut perfectly even joints.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Don't let others operator error prevent you from a great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot of people stating that it does not cut a parallel or even slot. With every tool you purchase there is always going to be setup and tuning. Invest in a mini machine square and a small combo square. All of the perameters are adjustable, cut depth, cut height, parallel to base plate. If you are new to useing the tool do your research. Remember to check it periodically that it has stayed in tune. Honestly this is a great tool. DeWalt has always built quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Balloch

customer_reviews.title: Fooled me!!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the deceiving pictures that show the hard case yet it only comes with the soft bag! Other than that the item was great.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Makes the job so much easier
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool it is so much better and faster and more precise than using wooden dowels........I like the Dewalt brand much better than the Porter Cable brand as these tools have gone down hill in he last few years so much so that I wont buy them anymore
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Get quality biscuits to complete the package
customer_reviews.text: This biscuit jointer was key in getting some of my large glue-up panels all together before the glue dried. I bought some cheepo biscuits and many of them didn't fit the slots securely. Need tight fitting biscuits to make the seams really line up.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Uptagrafft

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Never used one before, but understand the general concept. Instructions were very clear and helpful. #20 biscuits that I got from lowes work perfectly. Joined two scrap 6x6 boards and clamped properly. Then tested to failure, VERY strong joinery method.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This little device is a fantastic help when building furniture when you don’t want the hassle of making tongue and groove joints. It is quick and easy. Just be sure to check the stops first for accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: CRPTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Mis represented ad ,
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in a soft bag , not a hard case . I have a truck full of tools and supplies so the soft bags don t work well for me . I was expecting a hard case like the one the picture shows . Sending this one back
customer_reviews.author: yesican

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to help make wood boxes, worked great, also added some screws for added strength. A second use was to cut edge of deck boards for hidden fastener system, I needed to adjust depth to make a wider notch but it was a great tool for the job Another great Dewalt tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build some cutting boards to strengthen glue up and it performed almost flawlessly after making a few test cuts and simple adjustments. It lived up to all the positive reviews already submitted by others
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No soft case, as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as gift, picked this one for soft case that was pictured and in description, as he wanted that over heavy, bulky case. Got heavy black case.
customer_reviews.author: Momofaboy.

customer_reviews.title: Spot On!
customer_reviews.text: All the settings right out of the box are spot on. No adjustments were necessary. The dust bag collected all the shavings and none were left on the ground. I was really surprised as most dust bags are virtually useless. This is a fine addition to my DeWalt tool library. The price on Amazon was less than the B&M stores and delivery was overnite with "prime". Always a good experience with Amazon and thats why Amazon always gets first crack at my purchases. As far as the dust bag goes, make sure you empty it frequently and Im sure you will be more than satisfied with it. Made in Mexico, not China.
customer_reviews.author: JUST-JIM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool every thing works as it should. I wish it had a handle on top of the fold down plate so you could hold it against the work piece more securely and they could make it where you could put it on and take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Carter

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but will work great for wood trim!
customer_reviews.text: Building a log home. This works perfect and after watching youtube, it was a breeze to use. Going to use on window and door trim. Will work good for picture frames too! Instructions were strange and print super small. I don't need Spanish French and Chinese.
customer_reviews.author: Bru

customer_reviews.title: The cost was reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I can’t really say too much about my biscuit joiner but from the little use I’ve had with the the joiner is very easy to use and very accurate with the first couple cuts I’v done work perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Urena

customer_reviews.title: Great for connecting wide table boards
customer_reviews.text: Started building tables in my shop. Using this led to accuracy and level connections between boards. Use it also for picture frames and shadow box assembly.
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan Creations

customer_reviews.title: BISKET CUTTER
customer_reviews.text: I HAVEN'T USED THIS AS I AM GOING THROUGH MEDICAL TREATMENTS THAT MAKES YOU TIRED AND I LIKE ALL MY FINGER'S WHERE THEY ARE LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stoffal

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and precise.  Solid tool.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Powerful. Hold it tight to the piece, it has torque and can pull to the side as you pull the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K. Moore  II

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Plate Joiner
customer_reviews.text: I just found out about plate joiners and biscuits. I ended up choosing the DeWalt because of the quality of the other products I own. I love this joiner, easy and fun to use. I’m very pleased with this new tool!
customer_reviews.author: Leonard1953

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Item was just as described, packaged well for shipment and arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Eick

customer_reviews.title: This tool is easy to set up and cuts perfect slots
customer_reviews.text: I know people are getting away from doing biscuit joints and I don't know why. This tool is easy to set up and cuts perfect slots. I use it to assemble panels and small table tops
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Does not come with dust collection bag
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Does not come with dust collection bag, so watch where your face is the first time, I got a mouth full.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This tool is everything I have come to expect from DEWALT. I am renovating an old lake house using a lot of knotty pine and raw cedar. I wish I had purchased this plate joiner a few years back when I started this project. It is easy to use. The cabinet joints, facings and all other connections I have made a biscuit joint are perfect and look great. This is my 15th power shop tool purchased in as many years 7 are DEWALTs. Three are replacements for other brands that died. I am very pleased with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: T S

customer_reviews.title: I'm not saying it's as good as the Lamello
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a $1000 Lamello biscuit joiner when I worked in a cabinet shop. The dealt works amazingly well for how much it costs. I'm not saying it's as good as the Lamello, but its hard to tell the difference. This thing is accurate, easy to use, and I love the rack and pinion adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn to use and it made accurate cuts for joining cabinet materials.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he said it's great. The negative reviews may be from not adjusting it for the thickness of your board.
customer_reviews.author: Diver

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to buy one of these tools that you only use once in awhile. This things works great. I wish it had a better dust collection port.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to make you a better finish carpenter
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a great biscuit router that makes any corner or attachment of materials much stronger and tighter for the long road. So simple to use and once you use it often you will think of projects you wish you had this on. Like any routing type of tool it is going to make a bunch of sawdust no matter what you do but it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Ed

customer_reviews.title: What a difference a plate joiner makes.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've used a plate joiner for attaching biscuits and it works well. It's not too heavy and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: sleeper

customer_reviews.title: It worked perfect. Just finished building 4 tables
customer_reviews.text: As with all of the Dewalt tools I have purchased. It worked perfect. Just finished building 4 tables.
customer_reviews.author: jsh

customer_reviews.title: Easier Than Drilling Dowel Holes
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice tool to have. The quality seems to be there. I used it for hardwood and it was amazing how easy it cut the grooves.
customer_reviews.author: Buckminster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fabricate a floating wooden fireplace hearth / outerhearth over the existing tile one. It was easy to use and the hearth (quite big actually 10' x 16" + overhanging sides attached to it) looks great and after 2 years none of the wood has budged. Be prepared for some dust and clean the dust catcher regularly during work (if you are working inside). This tool was very easy to use and accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: ... would cut a biscuits slot straight other than that great
customer_reviews.text: Had to spend two hours on try to figure out how to adjust it so it would cut a biscuits slot straight other than that great product
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fregoe

customer_reviews.title: Good-to-go
customer_reviews.text: The price was good (for a DeWalt product) and the shipping was relatively fast. I mean, you have to pay for quality and DeWalt makes some high quality tools for sure that not only last a very long time, but hold their value in terms of trading or selling in the future. The joiner works well and is pretty close to being 100% accurate. It's a good tool and I'm glad I have in my shop!
customer_reviews.author: -Derrick0572

customer_reviews.title: Nice Machine
customer_reviews.text: Used it to build a Dart Board. Dust exhaust clogs! Only bad thing. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: To5m Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Every woodworker should own one of these..
customer_reviews.text: This joiner replaced one of those attachments you put on your router to do the same thing. HUGE difference. This is basically a one handed operation. With the router version I needed to clamp down the board, plunge the cutter and then slide side to side depending on the size of the disks. With this unit I don't even need to clamp it down. Make the job a lot easier and enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Special K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I doubt I'll ever dowel join again. This thing makes it so much faster to join.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Having the right tools for the job makes things run smoothly
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this on the job daily and is just right for him.
customer_reviews.author: Misti Randles

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This plate joiner has worked out very well for me. I am making octagon borders for several plants and bushes. It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John Nash

customer_reviews.title: Glad I’d made the
customer_reviews.text: Replace an older biscuit jointer with this model. Consistent and works when I need to join long boards. Glad I’d made the investment
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Dewalt Tool
customer_reviews.text: Works great and a nice addition to my tool collection. well made and very easy to use. I had to make a bunch of custom louvered doors for storage access behind the kneewalls of the upstairs of my cape cod and this was perfect for sturdy assembly and turned out a top quality product l
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: Stopped
customer_reviews.text: Won’t turn on after 1 month. Dewalt wants me to pay $75. for warranty. No customer service at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dcg

customer_reviews.title: Woodworking A+
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift last year, boyfriend loves making furniture and this has totally gotten its use and then some. Great product for the money
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Should've bought it earlier in my project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works as expected. Would recommend for the novice wood worker.
customer_reviews.author: OsFan

customer_reviews.title: but it's still a very nice tool. It will walk a bit if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Repeatable cuts can be a bit of a challenge, but it's still a very nice tool. It will walk a bit if you press down on the handle when starting. If you are careful to not do that, it doesn't seem to walk all that much. I had to adjust it a little to since the cuts were too deep out of the box, but it was an easy adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: N. Franke

customer_reviews.title: He loves it and tells me he got perfect results on his first practice joint
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son. He loves it and tells me he got perfect results on his first practice joint!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A.

customer_reviews.title: The best plate joiner
customer_reviews.text: I really like the precision of it and the power. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel A.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and priced well. I have used it every few months in my woodworking and finish carpentry business. I would advise you also purchase a kreg system to compliment the product and with both you can build most cabinets. I have not had a problem with this tool since I bought it in 2004, so if you buy one you should expect it will last without defect.
customer_reviews.author: B Roy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool. I have already used it to build ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. I have already used it to build a semi enclosed (Custom) cabinet with glued up top for my sons TKD studio. Everyone is happy with the final product and I am happy with the plate joiner. I can see myself using this tool on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY L HOFF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Dewalt again--6 stars
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt nailed it again. Always satisfied with the tools I have by Dewalt. Table saw--Miter saw--Angle grinder--Nail guns and now this. If there was 6 stars I would give it a 6.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to setup and works as it's supposed to. Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to setup and works as it's supposed to. Plug and play
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: makes work fast!
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, the port used to direct the sawdust seems to clog easily
customer_reviews.author: sllemmon

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first one! I have used several types of biscuit joiners over the years and this is the best I have found. Safe unit too if instructions are followed Only issue is the dust collection. Scrap material coming out of exhaust flange fills the flange rapidly requiring often cleaning. I just remove the bag and clean all up after cutting is done! With that said the machine has excellent quality and good accuracy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Valentino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son and he loves them. Uses them all the time and it works great
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Sour Dough Biscuit
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying two of these because I have a step son. The first unit was great. The cuts were square, and there was some scoring on the face to keep it from sliding. The second unit is useful for building a barn, if you are not picky. The bottom is not flat, and neither is the front. The scoring on the face is insufficient, and even with a jig, it wobbles because of its not being square. You may get one that is fine. I am going to buy a Porter-Cable or Makita.
customer_reviews.author: chalkjock

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with the hard case. BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: It show on Amazon that it comes with hard case. It's fault advertising. My came with a bag. Wow just wow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! - Must have for every shop - miss'n mine :o)
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago I bought my Dad one of these for Christmas. He had it a whole week before I borrowed it. He got it back a couple of years later. I have my own now. Last week, Dad borrowed mine since he left his at this other home out of state. I do hope to see it again. :o) Great tool, durable, and quick. Make sure you wear goggles, the wood does fly out. I skip using the dust bag on larger jobs since there is a tendency for the shoot to clog. That's why I have a shop vac. Thank God for the Knowledge he gave to mankind to make so many great tools.
customer_reviews.author: Spin'n my Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Have used only a few times but satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time and as advertised. Have used only a few times but satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: the joiner works pretty good. You do have to practice as my ...
customer_reviews.text: Other than the chips shoot up into my face, the joiner works pretty good. You do have to practice as my first few tries the biscuit slot was consistently crooked (the right side higher than the left). Practice makes perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo Bruddah

customer_reviews.title: Great Plate joiner for decking
customer_reviews.text: I used this to side cut all my deck boards when using a hidden fastener system. It worked great and I never had any problems with it. The depth settings worked great and the tightening screw held tight, so no problems with the depth changing on me. The deck I used this on was large and I used a hard brazilian wood so this received a lot of rugged use, and held up fine. I would definitely recommend for hidden fasteners. I read some reviews complaining about the cut being off a 1/32 of an inch from side to side. I didn't notice this, and with the hidden fasteners, it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Huskie

customer_reviews.title: great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Never owned a joiner before and read a lot of other reviews before I bought this one for a specific project. It was between this one and porter and cable model. The dewalt is easy to set up and use. I did not experience any of the negatives mentioned in other reviews. I did notice that it wanted to walk a bit when trying to plunge too quickly, but that was part of the learning curve in my opinion. I was not using large biscuits, but I didn't think the dust bag filled up quickly either. I didn't plan on using the vacuum attachment but it seems to be an odd size and doesn't fit my hoses regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: I realy like how you adjust it
customer_reviews.text: i have used my plate joiner a few times. I realy like how you adjust it .its my first joiner so I cant compare it to another. but this one works great. i did my research and desided on this joiner.i am glad I did .its pretty heavy duty to.. and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun new tool
customer_reviews.text: I was doing a couple of projects around the house, and decided it was time to use a plate joiner. This was excellent. It is solid and well made. Easy to operate. It works just as smoothly on Oak as it does on pine. It was fun to work with
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: If there is a better biscuit joiner on the market
customer_reviews.text: If there is a better biscuit joiner on the market, I haven't seen it. Easy to use and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal F Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt does it again! Great product and will make my projects easier and more professional. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This plate joiner rocks! Fun and easy to use! Must have for wood workers!
customer_reviews.author: Thewolfryder

customer_reviews.title: It’s a really good tool
customer_reviews.text: I’m remodeling my house and I building my own cabinets This tool make it do much easier
customer_reviews.author: gabriela dominguez

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: must have for all wood workers. this is really well made. this is not harbor freight junk. i got this for one of our custom cabinet projects. works like a charm. already paid itself few times over with one job. highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: never again shop retail

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have only used once but am very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Is working for me. Only issue I’ve had is that the sawdust tends to get stuck in the port going to the collection bag sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool, good range of adjust-ability, precise. Does have a tendency for the dust shoot to clog, when using it in a vertical position. But easy enough to unclog.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: It's a DeWalt... not much more to say
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a table project of mine. works great & I'm already planning other projects now that I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This was a deal of the day and that says it all. I have used this tool many times and really don’t know why I waited so long to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Helton

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great joiner. Has positive accurate settings and is easy to use. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Watch a short video first - (You Tube)
customer_reviews.text: what a blessing - was well worth the purchase. So easy to use - no hassles.

customer_reviews.title: cut slots for those awesome biscuits.

product_meta.title: DEWALT Plate Joiner Kit, 6.5-Amp (DW682K)
product_meta.description:
Style:Plate joinerDual Rack and Pinion fence ensure blade and fence are always parallel, integral one-piece fence is adjustable and tilts 0-90 degrees, flush cuts can be made at 0 degrees without removing fence, 45 degree locating notch in fence allows indexing off the outside surface of a mitered joint, non-marring, heavy-duty aluminum shoe, retractable, anti-slip pins, preset depth stops for all common biscuit sizes. Specs: 7/8" Arbor, No load speed 10, 000RPM, depth of cut (mm) 20mm, biscuits Accepted 0, 10, 20, weighs 6.6lbs. Includes: carbide blade, dust bag, vacuum adapter, Torx key, wrench, soft kit bag.

AMAZON.COM
The DEWALT DW682K Plate Joiner Kit allows you to cut slots for holding biscuits with precision. This kit includes an easy-to-adjust fence, a heavy-duty nonmarring shoe, and preset stops for all common biscuit sizes, so you can craft solid joints quickly and accurately.



Integrated, Adjustable Fence for Accuracy
Accuracy is critical when creating joints and The DEWALT Plate Joiner Kit delivers. Its dual rack-and-pinion fence is designed to ensure the blade and fence are always parallel--the toughest part of creating a perfect joint. This one-piece fence is integrated into the joiner's overall design for convenience, plus it's adjustable, and can be tilted at angles ranging from 0 to 90 degrees.The plate joiner's configuration allows you to make flush cuts without removing the fence. A 45-degree locating notch in the fence allows for easy indexing of an outside registration.

Dependable Motor for Quick, Precise Cuts
The DW682K's 6-1/2 amp, 10,000 rpm motor provides plenty of power for making cuts at depth of up to 20 millimeters--even in the hardest woods. The power behind the cut is an integral part of what makes this tool safer, as it prevents unexpected movements with your workpiece.

Convenient Design Details Including Preset Stops
Equipped with a non-marring, heavy-duty aluminum shoe, the DW682K can be clamped down for stable, stationary work. And whether you're using the joiner clamped down or as a free-moving unit, the retractable, antislip pins help hold your workpiece in place for the perfect cut. And it weighs just 6.6 pounds for easy handling.

For easy setup, the DW682K features preset depth stops for all common biscuit sizes of 0, 10, and 20.

The DW682K Plate Joiner Kit comes with a DEWALT warranty package that includes a three-year limited warranty, a one-year free service contract, and a 90-day money-back guarantee.

What's in the Box
DW682K Plate Joiner, carbide blade, dust bag, vacuum adapter, Torx key, wrench, and soft kit bag.
feature_bullets: 6.5 Amp, 10,000 rpm motor provides power for working in the hardest woods
Dual rack and pinion fence ensure blade and fence are always parallel for accurate joints every time
Integral one-piece fence is adjustable and tilts 0-90 degrees
Flush cuts can be made at 0 degrees without removing fence
45 degree locating notch in fence allows indexing off the outside surface of a mitered joint; non-marring, heavy-duty aluminum shoe allows joiner to be clamped for stationary work
